H0.text: They reproduce by mitosis, a characteristic shared by both euglena and amoeba.

H1.text: They eat by phagocytosis is a characteristic that a euglena shares with an amoeba.

H2.text: They respond to light stimuli is a characteristic that euglena shares with an amoeba.

H3.text: They move by changing shape is a characteristic that a euglena shares with an amoeba.

A4.text: Reproduction begins with the mitosis of the cell nucleus, followed by the division of the cell itself.

A5.text: When there is sufficient sunlight for it to feed by phototrophy, it uses chloroplasts containing the pigments chlorophyll a and chlorophyll b to produce sugars by photosynthesis.

A6.text: Light intensity affects the lipid composition of Euglena gracilis.
